sentences.english: Only the initial letter in the first word of any complimentary close is capitalized.
sentences.chinese: 任何结尾谦称用语都只大写第一个字的第一个字母。

sentences.english: "Qieshen" was a modest form of address used by women in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 妾身”是中国古代妇女对自己的谦称。

sentences.english: He always modestly calls himself a laymen in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 他总是谦称自己是书法艺术的门外汉。

definition: term of esteem/honorific (in Chinese grammar)/polite form of pronoun (in European grammar)
to praise too much/I really don't deserve so much praise
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to address sb directly by name (idiom)/to address sb by name without using an honorific title (indicating either familiarity or overfamiliarity)
honorific (e.g. in grammar of oriental languages)
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
